sentences.title: Brain tumor
sentences.sentence_text: A brain tumor occurs when a group of cells within the brain turn cancerous and grow out of control, creating a mass.

sentences.title: Brain tumor
sentences.sentence_text: There are two main types of tumors: malignant (cancerous) tumors and benign (non-cancerous) tumors.

sentences.title: Brain tumor
sentences.sentence_text: These can be further classified as primary tumors, which start within the brain, and secondary tumors, which most commonly have spread from tumors located outside the brain, known as brain metastasis tumors.

sentences.title: Brain tumor
sentences.sentence_text: All types of brain tumors may produce symptoms that vary depending on the size of the tumor and the part of the brain that is involved.

sentences.title: Brain tumor
sentences.sentence_text: Where symptoms exist, they may include headaches, seizures, problems with vision, vomiting and mental changes.

sentences.title: Brain tumor
sentences.sentence_text: Other symptoms may include difficulty walking, speaking, with sensations, or unconsciousness.

sentences.title: Tumor marker
sentences.sentence_text: A tumor marker is a biomarker that can be used to indicate the presence of cancer or the behavior of cancers.

sentences.title: Tumor marker
sentences.sentence_text: They can be found in bodily fluids or tissue.

sentences.title: Tumor marker
sentences.sentence_text: Markers can help with assessing prognosis, surveilling patients after surgical removal of tumors, and even predicting drug-response and monitor therapy.

sentences.title: Adrenal tumor
sentences.sentence_text: An adrenal tumor or adrenal mass is any benign or malignant neoplasms of the adrenal gland, several of which are notable for their ability to overproduce endocrine hormones.

sentences.title: Adrenal tumor
sentences.sentence_text: Adrenal cancer is the presence of malignant adrenal tumors, which include neuroblastoma, adrenocortical carcinoma and some adrenal pheochromocytomas.

sentences.title: Adrenal tumor
sentences.sentence_text: Most adrenal pheochromocytomas and all adrenocortical adenomas are benign tumors, which do not metastasize or invade nearby tissues, but may cause significant symptoms by dysregulating hormones.

sentences.title: Genomics
sentences.sentence_text: Genomics is an interdisciplinary field of molecular biology focusing on the structure, function, evolution, mapping, and editing of genomes.

sentences.title: Genomics
sentences.sentence_text: A genome is an organism's complete set of DNA, including all of its genes as well as its hierarchical, three-dimensional structural configuration.

sentences.title: Genomics
sentences.sentence_text: In contrast to genetics, which refers to the study of individual genes and their roles in inheritance, genomics aims at the collective characterization and quantification of all of an organism's genes, their interrelations and influence on the organism.

sentences.title: Genomics
sentences.sentence_text: Genes may direct the production of proteins with the assistance of enzymes and messenger molecules.

sentences.title: Genomics
sentences.sentence_text: In turn, proteins make up body structures such as organs and tissues as well as control chemical reactions and carry signals between cells.

sentences.title: Genomics
sentences.sentence_text: Genomics also involves the sequencing and analysis of genomes through uses of high throughput DNA sequencing and bioinformatics to assemble and analyze the function and structure of entire genomes.

sentences.title: Genomics
sentences.sentence_text: Advances in genomics have triggered a revolution in discovery-based research and systems biology to facilitate understanding of even the most complex biological systems such as the brain.

sentences.title: Benign tumor
sentences.sentence_text: A benign tumor is a mass of cells (tumor) that does not invade neighboring tissue or metastasize.

sentences.title: Benign tumor
sentences.sentence_text: Compared to malignant (cancerous) tumors, benign tumors generally have a slower growth rate.

sentences.title: Benign tumor
sentences.sentence_text: Benign tumors have relatively well differentiated cells.

sentences.title: Benign tumor
sentences.sentence_text: They are often surrounded by an outer surface or stay contained within the epithelium.

sentences.title: Benign tumor
sentences.sentence_text: Common examples of benign tumors include moles and uterine fibroids.

sentences.title: Genomic imprinting
sentences.sentence_text: Genomic imprinting is an epigenetic phenomenon that causes genes to be expressed or not, depending on whether they are inherited from the female or male parent.

sentences.title: Genomic imprinting
sentences.sentence_text: Genes can also be partially imprinted.

sentences.title: Genomic imprinting
sentences.sentence_text: Partial imprinting occurs when alleles from both parents are differently expressed rather than complete expression and complete suppression of one parent's allele.

sentences.title: Genomic imprinting
sentences.sentence_text: Forms of genomic imprinting have been demonstrated in fungi, plants and animals.

sentences.title: Genomic imprinting
sentences.sentence_text: In 2014, there were about 150 imprinted genes known in mice and about half that in humans.

sentences.title: Genomic imprinting
sentences.sentence_text: As of 2019, 260 imprinted genes have been reported in mice and 228 in humans.

sentences.title: Regulation of gene expression
sentences.sentence_text: Regulation of gene expression, or gene regulation, includes a wide range of mechanisms that are used by cells to increase or decrease the production of specific gene products.

sentences.title: Regulation of gene expression
sentences.sentence_text: Sophisticated programs of gene expression are widely observed in biology, for example to trigger developmental pathways, respond to environmental stimuli, or adapt to new food sources.

sentences.title: Regulation of gene expression
sentences.sentence_text: Virtually any step of gene expression can be modulated, from transcriptional initiation, to RNA processing, and to the post-translational modification of a protein.

sentences.title: Regulation of gene expression
sentences.sentence_text: Often, one gene regulator controls another, and so on, in a gene regulatory network.

sentences.title: Gene expression
sentences.sentence_text: Gene expression is the process by which the information contained within a gene is used to produce a functional gene product, such as a protein or a functional RNA molecule.

sentences.title: Gene expression
sentences.sentence_text: This process involves multiple steps, including the transcription of the gene's sequence into RNA.

sentences.title: Gene expression
sentences.sentence_text: For protein-coding genes, this RNA is further translated into a chain of amino acids that folds into a protein, while for non-coding genes, the resulting RNA itself serves a functional role in the cell.

sentences.title: Gene expression
sentences.sentence_text: Gene expression enables cells to utilize the genetic information in genes to carry out a wide range of biological functions.

sentences.title: Gene expression
sentences.sentence_text: While expression levels can be regulated in response to cellular needs and environmental changes, some genes are expressed continuously with little variation.

sentences.title: Genomic Surveillance and Prediction of Antibiotic Resistance Trends Using AI Tools
sentences.sentence_text: Antibiotic resistance (AMR) is a global public health crisis that threatens the efficacy of many life-saving antibiotics.

sentences.title: Genomic Surveillance and Prediction of Antibiotic Resistance Trends Using AI Tools
sentences.sentence_text: As resistance patterns continue to evolve and spread, traditional surveillance methods struggle to keep pace with the complexity and scale of the issue.

sentences.title: Genomic Surveillance and Prediction of Antibiotic Resistance Trends Using AI Tools
sentences.sentence_text: Genomic surveillance, particularly when integrated with advanced Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools, offers a powerful solution to track, predict, and mitigate the emergence of resistant bacterial strains.

sentences.title: Genomic Surveillance and Prediction of Antibiotic Resistance Trends Using AI Tools
sentences.sentence_text: This paper explores the role of AI in genomic surveillance, highlighting how machine learning and deep learning algorithms can analyze vast genomic datasets to identify resistance genes, mutations, and emerging resistance trends.

sentences.title: Genomic Surveillance and Prediction of Antibiotic Resistance Trends Using AI Tools
sentences.sentence_text: By combining genomic, clinical, and environmental data, AI-powered models can predict resistance patterns, enabling early detection and more targeted public health interventions.

sentences.title: Genomic Surveillance and Prediction of Antibiotic Resistance Trends Using AI Tools
sentences.sentence_text: The paper examines various AI techniques, including supervised and unsupervised learning, and their application in forecasting antibiotic resistance in pathogens like Escherichia coli and Mycobacterium tuberculosis.

sentences.title: Genomic Surveillance and Prediction of Antibiotic Resistance Trends Using AI Tools
sentences.sentence_text: Despite the promising potential, challenges such as data quality, model generalizability, and ethical concerns persist.

sentences.title: Genomic Surveillance and Prediction of Antibiotic Resistance Trends Using AI Tools
sentences.sentence_text: Nevertheless, the integration of AI into genomic surveillance holds transformative potential for enhancing global efforts to combat AMR, providing real-time insights and more effective strategies for antibiotic stewardship.

sentences.title: Genomic Surveillance and Prediction of Antibiotic Resistance Trends Using AI Tools
sentences.sentence_text: The paper concludes by discussing future directions for AI in genomic surveillance, emphasizing the need for further research, collaboration, and global data sharing to improve predictive capabilities and combat antibiotic resistance effectively.

sentences.title: Enhancing early detection of pancreatic cancer by integrating AI with advanced imaging techniques
sentences.sentence_text: Pancreatic cancer remains one of the most lethal malignancies, with a five-year survival rate of less than 10%, primarily due to late-stage diagnosis and rapid disease progression.

sentences.title: Enhancing early detection of pancreatic cancer by integrating AI with advanced imaging techniques
sentences.sentence_text: Early detection is critical for improving patient outcomes, yet current diagnostic methods lack the sensitivity and specificity needed for effective screening.

sentences.title: Enhancing early detection of pancreatic cancer by integrating AI with advanced imaging techniques
sentences.sentence_text: This review explores the integration of advanced imaging techniques with artificial intelligence (AI) to enhance the early detection of pancreatic cancer.

sentences.title: Enhancing early detection of pancreatic cancer by integrating AI with advanced imaging techniques
sentences.sentence_text: Emphasizing a biological approach, we examine the underlying molecular and cellular mechanisms that contribute to the pathogenesis of pancreatic cancer and how they manifest in imaging data.

sentences.title: Enhancing early detection of pancreatic cancer by integrating AI with advanced imaging techniques
sentences.sentence_text: Key imaging modalities, including high-resolution magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), computed tomography (CT), and positron emission tomography (PET), are evaluated for their efficacy in visualizing pancreatic abnormalities.

sentences.title: Enhancing early detection of pancreatic cancer by integrating AI with advanced imaging techniques
sentences.sentence_text: AI algorithms, particularly machine learning and deep learning, are discussed in the context of their ability to analyze complex imaging datasets, identify subtle biomarkers, and predict disease onset with high accuracy.

sentences.title: Enhancing early detection of pancreatic cancer by integrating AI with advanced imaging techniques
sentences.sentence_text: We delve into the biological markers that AI algorithms can detect, such as changes in the tumor microenvironment, alterations in tissue architecture, and specific molecular signatures of pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC).

sentences.title: Enhancing early detection of pancreatic cancer by integrating AI with advanced imaging techniques
sentences.sentence_text: Furthermore, the integration of AI with molecular imaging techniques, such as positron emission tomography-magnetic resonance imaging (PET-MRI) and optical coherence tomography (OCT), is explored to provide a multi-faceted approach to early diagnosis.

sentences.title: Enhancing early detection of pancreatic cancer by integrating AI with advanced imaging techniques
sentences.sentence_text: The review also highlights the potential of combining AI-driven imaging with liquid biopsies and genomics to create a comprehensive diagnostic framework.

sentences.title: Enhancing early detection of pancreatic cancer by integrating AI with advanced imaging techniques
sentences.sentence_text: By leveraging the power of AI to interpret complex biological data, we propose a novel paradigm for the early detection of pancreatic cancer, aiming to improve screening protocols, enable timely therapeutic interventions, and ultimately enhance patient survival rates.

sentences.title: Enhancing early detection of pancreatic cancer by integrating AI with advanced imaging techniques
sentences.sentence_text: In supposition, the integration of AI with advanced imaging techniques holds significant promise for revolutionizing the early detection of pancreatic cancer.

sentences.title: Enhancing early detection of pancreatic cancer by integrating AI with advanced imaging techniques
sentences.sentence_text: Continued research and clinical validation are essential to translate these technological advancements into routine clinical practice, offering hope for better prognostic outcomes in patients with this devastating disease.

sentences.title: AI-Powered Smart Smile: Early Detection of Mental Health Conditions Through Computational Intelligence
sentences.sentence_text: The early detection of mental health conditions is crucial for timely intervention and effective treatment.

sentences.title: AI-Powered Smart Smile: Early Detection of Mental Health Conditions Through Computational Intelligence
sentences.sentence_text: This study presents the development and evaluation of the “Smart Smile” application, an AI-powered tool designed to detect early signs of mental health issues using computational intelligence.

sentences.title: AI-Powered Smart Smile: Early Detection of Mental Health Conditions Through Computational Intelligence
sentences.sentence_text: The primary objective of this research is to design a robust system that leverages artificial intelligence and machine learning algorithms to analyze user interactions and biometric data to identify potential mental health concerns.

sentences.title: AI-Powered Smart Smile: Early Detection of Mental Health Conditions Through Computational Intelligence
sentences.sentence_text: The scope of the study includes the integration of various data sources such as facial expressions, voice tone, text input, and user behavior patterns.

sentences.title: AI-Powered Smart Smile: Early Detection of Mental Health Conditions Through Computational Intelligence
sentences.sentence_text: The methods employed in this research encompass data collection through user surveys and real-time monitoring, followed by the application of machine learning techniques for data analysis.

sentences.title: AI-Powered Smart Smile: Early Detection of Mental Health Conditions Through Computational Intelligence
sentences.sentence_text: Specifically, convolutional neural networks (CNNs) and natural language processing (NLP) algorithms are utilized to process and interpret the collected data.

sentences.title: AI-Powered Smart Smile: Early Detection of Mental Health Conditions Through Computational Intelligence
sentences.sentence_text: Key findings from this study indicate that the Smart Smile application can accurately predict early signs of conditions such as depression and anxiety with a high degree of accuracy.

sentences.title: AI-Powered Smart Smile: Early Detection of Mental Health Conditions Through Computational Intelligence
sentences.sentence_text: The application's performance is validated through extensive testing and cross-validation against established mental health assessment tools.

sentences.title: AI-Powered Smart Smile: Early Detection of Mental Health Conditions Through Computational Intelligence
sentences.sentence_text: The results demonstrate the potential of AI and computational intelligence in enhancing mental health diagnostics and providing users with actionable insights.

sentences.title: AI-Powered Smart Smile: Early Detection of Mental Health Conditions Through Computational Intelligence
sentences.sentence_text: In conclusion, the AI-powered Smart Smile application represents a significant advancement in the field of mental health care, offering a scalable and accessible solution for early detection of mental health conditions.

sentences.title: AI-Powered Smart Smile: Early Detection of Mental Health Conditions Through Computational Intelligence
sentences.sentence_text: Future work will focus on improving the algorithm's accuracy, expanding the dataset, and integrating additional features to support a broader range of mental health conditions.

sentences.title: AI and ML in Genomic Research: Unlocking the Potential of Precision Medicine
sentences.sentence_text: Analyzing genomic data at scale would be nearly impossible without cost-efficient mechanisms working in the background to make such analysis accessible to all.

sentences.title: AI and ML in Genomic Research: Unlocking the Potential of Precision Medicine
sentences.sentence_text: This reality highlights the exciting potential of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML), which are ushering in a new era of genomic research grounded in precision medicine.

sentences.title: AI and ML in Genomic Research: Unlocking the Potential of Precision Medicine
sentences.sentence_text: AI and ML have introduced novel approaches to handle the massive volumes of genomic data, uncovering complex biological and genetic patterns that traditional methods often struggle to interpret.

sentences.title: AI and ML in Genomic Research: Unlocking the Potential of Precision Medicine
sentences.sentence_text: This integration not only deepens our understanding of the genetic underpinnings of diseases but also accelerates the development of personalized diagnostic, prognostic, and therapeutic strategies.

sentences.title: AI and ML in Genomic Research: Unlocking the Potential of Precision Medicine
sentences.sentence_text: These technologies have dramatically improved the affordability, speed, and accuracy of genomic sequencing analysis.

sentences.title: AI and ML in Genomic Research: Unlocking the Potential of Precision Medicine
sentences.sentence_text: Deep learning models can now process raw sequence data in detail, identifying mutations, structural variations, and gene expressions with remarkable precision.

sentences.title: AI and ML in Genomic Research: Unlocking the Potential of Precision Medicine
sentences.sentence_text: These advanced systems analyze millions of data points to predict disease risks, determine the most effective treatments, anticipate drug side effects, and help clinicians create personalized care plans.

sentences.title: AI and ML in Genomic Research: Unlocking the Potential of Precision Medicine
sentences.sentence_text: In fields like oncology, AI-powered tools are narrowing down potential biomarkers for complex diseases—such as cancer, diabetes, and neurodegenerative disorders—enabling earlier diagnoses and more targeted therapies.

sentences.title: AI and ML in Genomic Research: Unlocking the Potential of Precision Medicine
sentences.sentence_text: ML is also revolutionizing pharmacogenomics by identifying how genetic profiles influence drug responses.

sentences.title: AI and ML in Genomic Research: Unlocking the Potential of Precision Medicine
sentences.sentence_text: This reduces the guesswork in drug selection, lowers the risk of side effects, and improves overall treatment outcomes.

sentences.title: AI and ML in Genomic Research: Unlocking the Potential of Precision Medicine
sentences.sentence_text: Specifically in cancer treatment, ML models are helping oncologists design personalized treatment regimens based on the unique genetic makeup of a tumor, ultimately improving disease management and survival rates.

sentences.title: AI and ML in Genomic Research: Unlocking the Potential of Precision Medicine
sentences.sentence_text: Moreover, AI and ML play a crucial role in integrating multi-omics data— including genomics, transcriptomics, proteomics, and metabolomics—to provide a comprehensive view of disease mechanisms.

sentences.title: AI and ML in Genomic Research: Unlocking the Potential of Precision Medicine
sentences.sentence_text: These integrative approaches are vital for understanding how genes and their expressions shape biological functions and disease states.

sentences.title: AI and ML in Genomic Research: Unlocking the Potential of Precision Medicine
sentences.sentence_text: Across the biomedical field, these AI-driven systems are powering tools that help clinicians and researchers keep up with the latest scientific breakthroughs and medical guidelines, through automated literature mining and clinical decision support.

sentences.title: AI Driven Detection of Skin and Oral Cancer: A Survey of Machine Learning and Deep Learning Approaches
sentences.sentence_text: Machine learning (ML) and deep learning (DL) are increasingly important in enhancing the diagnosis of skin and oral cancers, where early detection is critical for improving patient outcomes.

sentences.title: AI Driven Detection of Skin and Oral Cancer: A Survey of Machine Learning and Deep Learning Approaches
sentences.sentence_text: Traditionally reliant on visual assessments and clinical tests, cancer diagnosis can be prone to human error.

sentences.title: AI Driven Detection of Skin and Oral Cancer: A Survey of Machine Learning and Deep Learning Approaches
sentences.sentence_text: ML and DL offer a scalable, automated approach, analyzing medical images and genomic data to identify patterns that may be missed by humans.

sentences.title: AI Driven Detection of Skin and Oral Cancer: A Survey of Machine Learning and Deep Learning Approaches
sentences.sentence_text: Advanced models like Inception-v3 and ResNet have shown promise in improving skin cancer diagnosis, while techniques such as Random Forest and Support Vector Machines (SVM) are used for oral cancer analysis.

sentences.title: AI Driven Detection of Skin and Oral Cancer: A Survey of Machine Learning and Deep Learning Approaches
sentences.sentence_text: However, small and imbalanced datasets remain a major challenge, affecting model performance.

sentences.title: AI Driven Detection of Skin and Oral Cancer: A Survey of Machine Learning and Deep Learning Approaches
sentences.sentence_text: Key issues like data preprocessing, feature selection, and model training also limit the effectiveness of these methods.

sentences.title: AI Driven Detection of Skin and Oral Cancer: A Survey of Machine Learning and Deep Learning Approaches
sentences.sentence_text: Recent advancements, such as explainable AI and multimodal data fusion, are improving the transparency and clinical acceptance of these models.

sentences.title: AI Driven Detection of Skin and Oral Cancer: A Survey of Machine Learning and Deep Learning Approaches
sentences.sentence_text: However, a critical issue persists: ensuring that models can efficiently handle real-world data without delays, which is crucial for their integration into patient care.

sentences.title: AI Driven Detection of Skin and Oral Cancer: A Survey of Machine Learning and Deep Learning Approaches
sentences.sentence_text: This paper explores these developments and challenges, highlighting the need to address these issues before ML and DL can be fully integrated into clinical cancer diagnosis.

sentences.title: Abstract C056: Characterization of chromatin accessibility patterns in the human pancreas and early pancreatic neoplastic lesions using snATAC-seq
sentences.sentence_text: Study of early pancreas neoplasia in humans had previously been limited by lack of available tissue.

sentences.title: Abstract C056: Characterization of chromatin accessibility patterns in the human pancreas and early pancreatic neoplastic lesions using snATAC-seq
sentences.sentence_text: Recent work by our group on deceased donor pancreata identified pancreatic intraepithelial neoplasia (PanIN) lesions in non-diseased organs and defined a transcriptomic signature for the microenvironment of these pre-cancerous lesions.

sentences.title: Abstract C056: Characterization of chromatin accessibility patterns in the human pancreas and early pancreatic neoplastic lesions using snATAC-seq
sentences.sentence_text: Prevalence of PanINs in healthy human tissue was higher than expected and established a novel model to expand understanding of the complex biology of these precursor lesions.

sentences.title: Abstract C056: Characterization of chromatin accessibility patterns in the human pancreas and early pancreatic neoplastic lesions using snATAC-seq
sentences.sentence_text: Epigenetic changes in chromatin structure and the subsequent effects on gene expression are essential processes in neoplasia that have yet to be described at the single cell level in the human pancreas.

sentences.title: Abstract C056: Characterization of chromatin accessibility patterns in the human pancreas and early pancreatic neoplastic lesions using snATAC-seq
sentences.sentence_text: We hypothesized that previously defined gene signatures could identify acinar, ductal, and PanIN cells in donor pancreata based on chromatin accessibility profiling by single nuclear transposase-accessible chromatin preparation followed by high-throughput sequencing (snATAC-seq).

sentences.title: Abstract C056: Characterization of chromatin accessibility patterns in the human pancreas and early pancreatic neoplastic lesions using snATAC-seq
sentences.sentence_text: Comparison between the accessibility patterns, transcription factor motifs, and differences in accessibility versus expression profiles can then be used to expand prior knowledge of early pancreatic neoplasia and identify novel targets for further study and therapy selection.

sentences.title: Abstract C056: Characterization of chromatin accessibility patterns in the human pancreas and early pancreatic neoplastic lesions using snATAC-seq
sentences.sentence_text: To test this hypothesis, single nuclei from seventeen donor pancreata (twenty total samples) were isolated for snATAC-seq using the 10x Genomics platform.

sentences.title: Abstract C056: Characterization of chromatin accessibility patterns in the human pancreas and early pancreatic neoplastic lesions using snATAC-seq
sentences.sentence_text: Data analysis was conducted using CellRanger, Seurat, Signac, AUCell, and other programs to identify and label chromatin peaks in individual nuclei corresponding to acinar, ductal, and PanIN origin according to gene signatures identified by scRNA-seq and special transcriptomics on matched donor pancreata.

sentences.title: Abstract C056: Characterization of chromatin accessibility patterns in the human pancreas and early pancreatic neoplastic lesions using snATAC-seq
sentences.sentence_text: Using this method, cells corresponding to these gene signatures, including PanIN- like cells, were indeed identifiable with differentially accessible regions of the genome then analyzed for transcription factor motif enrichment between these cell types.

sentences.title: Abstract C056: Characterization of chromatin accessibility patterns in the human pancreas and early pancreatic neoplastic lesions using snATAC-seq
sentences.sentence_text: Motifs enriched in cells identified as PanINs compared to either ductal or acinar cells included several transcription factors implicated in tumorigenesis.

sentences.title: Abstract C056: Characterization of chromatin accessibility patterns in the human pancreas and early pancreatic neoplastic lesions using snATAC-seq
sentences.sentence_text: These results are similar to previously demonstrated essential factors in pancreatic neoplasia, suggesting this strategy is a relevant method for data analysis and discovery of novel factors implicated in tumorigenesis.

sentences.title: Abstract C056: Characterization of chromatin accessibility patterns in the human pancreas and early pancreatic neoplastic lesions using snATAC-seq
sentences.sentence_text: Ongoing studies include validation of these findings in vitro using human pancreatic normal epithelial cells, human tumor cell lines, and organoid models derived from human normal and tumor samples.

sentences.title: Abstract C056: Characterization of chromatin accessibility patterns in the human pancreas and early pancreatic neoplastic lesions using snATAC-seq
sentences.sentence_text: Together, this study demonstrates that PanINs can be identified in human pancreas tissue by snATAC-seq and that differentially expressed motifs can be identified, providing opportunity for further integration with transcriptomic information to elucidate detailed understanding of early neoplasia in the pancreas for future drug development and targeted therapeutics studies.

sentences.title: Abstract C056: Characterization of chromatin accessibility patterns in the human pancreas and early pancreatic neoplastic lesions using snATAC-seq
sentences.sentence_text: Citation Format: Jamie N Mills, Aaron Dendekker, Joyce K Thompson, Hannah Watkoske, Simone Benitz, Padma Kadiyala, Ahmed Elhossiny, Howard Crawford, Eileen Carpenter, Marina Pasca di Magliano, Filip Bednar.

sentences.title: Abstract C032: Visceral fat area and age-related differences in visceral adipose tissue gene expression: implications for early-onset colorectal cancer
sentences.sentence_text: Obesity is a known risk factor for colorectal cancer (CRC).

sentences.title: Abstract C032: Visceral fat area and age-related differences in visceral adipose tissue gene expression: implications for early-onset colorectal cancer
sentences.sentence_text: Specifically, visceral adipose tissue (VAT) can contribute to tumor development through mechanisms such as adipokine secretion and insulin resistance.

sentences.title: Abstract C032: Visceral fat area and age-related differences in visceral adipose tissue gene expression: implications for early-onset colorectal cancer
sentences.sentence_text: With aging, changes in VAT composition are accompanied by shifts in its metabolic and immune functions, potentially altering its interaction with adjacent tumors.

sentences.title: Abstract C032: Visceral fat area and age-related differences in visceral adipose tissue gene expression: implications for early-onset colorectal cancer
sentences.sentence_text: These age-related differences may influence CRC development and progression and give rise to early-onset CRC (EOCRC), defined as those diagnosed before the age of 50.

sentences.title: Abstract C032: Visceral fat area and age-related differences in visceral adipose tissue gene expression: implications for early-onset colorectal cancer
sentences.sentence_text: To explore this, we examined how visceral fat area (VFA), used as a validated proxy for total VAT volume, relates to VAT gene expression in CRC patients, and whether these associations differed by age at diagnosis.

sentences.title: Abstract C032: Visceral fat area and age-related differences in visceral adipose tissue gene expression: implications for early-onset colorectal cancer
sentences.sentence_text: Tumor-adjacent VAT was collected in 88 stage I-III CRC patients undergoing primary surgery as part of the ColoCare Study at Huntsman Cancer Institute (HCI), University of Utah, and Heidelberg University Hospital, Germany.

sentences.title: Abstract C032: Visceral fat area and age-related differences in visceral adipose tissue gene expression: implications for early-onset colorectal cancer
sentences.sentence_text: RNA sequencing was performed on VAT at the HCI genomics core.

sentences.title: Abstract C032: Visceral fat area and age-related differences in visceral adipose tissue gene expression: implications for early-onset colorectal cancer
sentences.sentence_text: VFA was quantified from computed tomography (CT) scans, derived from a single-slice CT image at the L3 level, and categorized, as based on median VFA value, [CU1] as low (<196 cm2) or high (≥196 cm2).

sentences.title: Abstract C032: Visceral fat area and age-related differences in visceral adipose tissue gene expression: implications for early-onset colorectal cancer
sentences.sentence_text: We assessed differential[CU2] gene expression in relation to high vs. low VFA within each age stratum (<50 years and ≥50 years), adjusting for study site, sex, tumor stage, and tumor site.

sentences.title: Abstract C032: Visceral fat area and age-related differences in visceral adipose tissue gene expression: implications for early-onset colorectal cancer
sentences.sentence_text: Ranked genes were analyzed with GSEA software to identify enriched gene sets and pathways.

sentences.title: Abstract C032: Visceral fat area and age-related differences in visceral adipose tissue gene expression: implications for early-onset colorectal cancer
sentences.sentence_text: Of 88 patients, 10 were EOCRC (median age 46, SD 8.3) and 78 w[PE3] [PE4] [PE5] ere later-onset CRC (LOCRC, median age 67, SD 15.8).

sentences.title: Abstract C032: Visceral fat area and age-related differences in visceral adipose tissue gene expression: implications for early-onset colorectal cancer
sentences.sentence_text: Among EOCRC patients, 60% had low VFA (<196 cm2), while in the LOCRC group, 47% had low VFA (≥196 cm2).

sentences.title: Abstract C032: Visceral fat area and age-related differences in visceral adipose tissue gene expression: implications for early-onset colorectal cancer
sentences.sentence_text: GSEA identified several immune-related pathways positively enriched among genes upregulated in high vs low VFA within both age strata.

sentences.title: Abstract C032: Visceral fat area and age-related differences in visceral adipose tissue gene expression: implications for early-onset colorectal cancer
sentences.sentence_text: Notably, Hematopoietic Cell Lineage was concordantly enriched in both EOCRC and LOCRC.

sentences.title: Abstract C032: Visceral fat area and age-related differences in visceral adipose tissue gene expression: implications for early-onset colorectal cancer
sentences.sentence_text: Age-specific patterns emerged: extracellular matrix and cytokine-cytokine receptor interaction pathways were predominantly enriched in LOCRC patients, whereas adaptive immune signaling and immunodeficiency pathways were specific to EOCRC patients.

sentences.title: Abstract C032: Visceral fat area and age-related differences in visceral adipose tissue gene expression: implications for early-onset colorectal cancer
sentences.sentence_text: High VFA is associated with distinct VAT gene expression profiles in CRC patients, and age-specific pathways emerged.

sentences.title: Abstract C032: Visceral fat area and age-related differences in visceral adipose tissue gene expression: implications for early-onset colorectal cancer
sentences.sentence_text: These findings indicate that VAT may modulate CRC biology in an age-dependent manner, potentially contributing to the development of EOCRC.

sentences.title: Abstract C032: Visceral fat area and age-related differences in visceral adipose tissue gene expression: implications for early-onset colorectal cancer
sentences.sentence_text: In: Proceedings of the AACR Special Conference in Cancer Research: The Rise in Early-Onset Cancers—Knowledge Gaps and Research Opportunities; 2025 Dec 10-13; Montreal, QC, Canada.

sentences.title: Abstract C032: Visceral fat area and age-related differences in visceral adipose tissue gene expression: implications for early-onset colorectal cancer

sentences.title: AI-Driven Insights into Fetal Genomics for Predicting Developmental Anomalies
sentences.sentence_text: This paper improves fetal health monitoring: The goal is to transform prenatal healthcare by developing a cutting-edge software platform for ongoing fetal health monitoring and analysis using a Django Server for Comprehensive Tracking and Analysis.

sentences.title: AI-Driven Insights into Fetal Genomics for Predicting Developmental Anomalies
sentences.sentence_text: This system handles and analyzes IoT sensor data on fetal health measures, including as heart rate, movement, and other critical indicators, using a robust, scalable backend server built with the Django web framework.

sentences.title: AI-Driven Insights into Fetal Genomics for Predicting Developmental Anomalies
sentences.sentence_text: Real-time data collection, storing, and analysis are done by Django's core server.

sentences.title: AI-Driven Insights into Fetal Genomics for Predicting Developmental Anomalies
sentences.sentence_text: The system uses machine learning and contemporary data processing techniques to identify health-related patterns.

sentences.title: AI-Driven Insights into Fetal Genomics for Predicting Developmental Anomalies
sentences.sentence_text: By giving physicians useful information, these tools help them identify fetal abnormalities early and improve outcomes.

sentences.title: AI-Driven Insights into Fetal Genomics for Predicting Developmental Anomalies
sentences.sentence_text: Expectant parents and medical professionals can view real-time health metrics on the website's user-friendly dashboards and graphs.

sentences.title: AI-Driven Insights into Fetal Genomics for Predicting Developmental Anomalies
sentences.sentence_text: The project's major component is its intuitive desktop and mobile web interface.

sentences.title: AI-Driven Insights into Fetal Genomics for Predicting Developmental Anomalies
sentences.sentence_text: Parents can track their unborn kid through this interface, and clinicians can view patient data in real time, analyze trends, and make informed decisions.

sentences.title: AI-Driven Insights into Fetal Genomics for Predicting Developmental Anomalies
sentences.sentence_text: Proper actions are taken on time through messages or alerts for abnormal readings with the help of the intelligent alert mechanism of the system.

sentences.title: AI-Driven Insights into Fetal Genomics for Predicting Developmental Anomalies
sentences.sentence_text: This real-world application of health care based on Django bridges with IoT data collection for an all-inclusive and effective fetal health monitoring program.

sentences.title: AI-Driven Insights into Fetal Genomics for Predicting Developmental Anomalies
sentences.sentence_text: Real-time monitoring, intelligent analytics, and easily available visualizations enhance prenatal care through providing early and accurate insights toward improving maternal and fetal outcomes.
